parameters: \pop[2]We're greeted to a sight that's almost nothing like the rest of the building.
\pop[2]The server room is almost black, while everything has a pulsing blue light.
\pop[2]It almost looks like the room is breathing, and it's a little unsettling.
\pop[2]Especially since I knew I was looking at \c[10]The System\c[0].
\pop[2]The shackled AI that governs our points, and runs in all of our devices.
\pop[2]I remember my Counselor telling me the story if how it came to be.
\pop[2]Isaac immediately runs over to one of the available computer terminals.
\pop[2]They must be hooked up directly to the servers, and the AI.
This should only take a few minutes.
\pop[3]\c[14]What\c[0] should only take a few minutes?
\pop[2]It's almost like Isaac doesn't even hear him.
\pop[2]He immediately takes out that cord, and connects his phone to the computer.
\pop[2]Dante scans the room, looking around with peaked curiosity.
\pop[3]At least the lobby didn't look like this.
Definitely feels like they were going for "ominous".
\pop[2]Klace looks scared. He's looked that way all day, in fact.
They have an HQ in every major city.
Spreading them out just saves space.
\pop[3]Our phones all have the same clearance level, right?
\pop[2]Isaac talks like he's super preoccupied, almost not even paying attention.
\pop[3]I'm gonna go use that other computer, then.
\pop[2]Isaac uses another cord to hook a disc drive up to the computer.
\pop[2]I look over at Dante, and it looks like he has no idea what he's doing.
\pop[2]The difference in skill between the two of them really highlights Isaac's prowess.
\pop[4]Don't worry, we'll have plenty of time left to spare.
\pop[2]There's really nothing I can do, so I just stand and watch Isaac.
\pop[2]Klace paces around the room, clearly anxious. Kyron just taps his foot on the floor.
\pop[2]We were in the heart of \c[10]Argus\c[0]. Isaac had access to \c[14]everything\c[0] on that computer.
\pop[2]Whatever he was looking at, it was flashing \c[14]really\c[0] fast.
\pop[2]His eyes are wide open, completely glued to the screen.
\pop[2]It was almost like blinking even once would be too much.
\pop[2]The flashing was clearly windows being opened and closed in rapid succession.
\pop[2]There's no way he could read, or even comprehend what was on the screen.
\pop[2]Yet the pace of his typing implies he does, and it's a sight to behold.
\pop[2]He keeps typing, and I start to feel bad for asking.
\pop[2]Whatever he was doing seemed to require the highest levels of concentration.
\pop[2]But a moment later, the screen stops flashing, and he sighs in relief.
But that's phase one out of the way.
\pop[2]He looks at me and smirks. It's a totally uncharacteristic smirk.
\pop[2]Or perhaps "sly" is the right word. Like he got away with something.
\pop[2]Dante returns from the computer he was using. He looks irate.
\pop[3]Are you gonna tell us what's going on?
Starting to get some weird vibes, Isaac.
\pop[2]He unplugs the disc drive, and holds it up, waving it at us.
\pop[2]It's a gesture that gives it our immediate attention.
\pop[4]Every single classified file in their database.
Including digitized records of stuff as far back as the 1940's.
\pop[2]He places it down on the table, a loud thud echoes through the room.
\pop[4]If they had something to do with \c[17]Komorebi\c[0], it'll be in here.
Whether they caused it, or used it for their own gain.
\pop[2]He goes back to typing away again.
\pop[4]Absolutely. But it wasn't really part of my plan.
I just... couldn't resist the temptation.
\pop[4]I kept seeing one word in particular, though.
Back in the 1940's, and even today, with the \c[10]Nostalgia Tech\c[0].
\pop[4]Your guess is as good as mine.
But it was tied to almost \c[14]every\c[0] classified document.
All you're gonna do is put a bigger target on us!
\pop[3]You can't have files like that, Isaac.
You're gonna get us all killed!
\pop[3]I thought you were just here to-
\pop[2]A second later, all the TV's in the room turn to static.
\pop[2]There wasn't a lot of them, but a couple lined the walls.
\pop[2]As if following suit, our phones vibrate shortly after.
\pop[2]I take out my phone to look.
\pop[2]I think we all just got the same notification.
\pop[2]He keeps typing, like his life depends on it.
\pop[2]And due to holding such a sensitive drive, maybe it does.
\pop[2]Not just for him, but perhaps all of us as well.
\pop[2]I turn my attention toward one of the TV's on the wall.
\pop[2]So, the leader of \c[10]Argus\c[0] was about to appear for the first time?
\pop[2]And not only that, but we're on the clock. Time is running out.
\pop[2]Just \c[14]who\c[0] were they? What were they going to say?
\pop[2]My eyes are now glued to the TV much like Isaac's are to his monitor.
\pop[2]We all wait in anticipation, as the camera cuts to a shot of the town square.
